result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathaniel Howard Guard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary Of A Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary Of A Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 3 and case 22CF888. Credit for 220 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
MAT program. Defendant to continue MAT program after serving condition time.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
Parenting classes.
Cognitive Intervention Program.
Restorative Justice Program.
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications and follow through and comply with any recommended treatment.
AODA assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety.

No contact with victims and victims residence.  State to file Order.
No contact with firearms.
Restitution set at $3,248.31 payable to Arial S. and $974.79 payable to Glendale Kohls Department Store.  To be paid first, due by the end of probation.

Provide DNA sample.
All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and restitution to be paid including DNA surcharge during the period of probation.  If revoked to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court waives all nonmandatory costs due to inability to pay.

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes: 25 hours community service, 25 hours per year and to be completed during probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathaniel Howard Guard

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nathaniel Howard Guard in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Nathaniel Howard Guard.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for sentencing hearing. 

Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1.  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 8 YEARS, concurrent to COUNT 3 and case 22CF888, with credit for 220 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 4 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS. Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 4 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 3.  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 8 YEARS, concurrent to COUNT 1 and case 22CF888, with credit for 220 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 4 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS. Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 4 YEARS.

*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Serve 1 YEAR in House of Correction as Condition Time.
-MAT program; defendant to continue MAT program after serving condition time. 
-Parenting classes.
-Cognitive Intervention Program.
-Restorative Justice Program.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications and follow through and comply with any recommended treatment. 
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victims and victims residence; State to file order. 
-Vocational Training.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No contact with firearms.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-25 Hours community service; 25 hours per year, and to be completed during probation. 
-Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
-Restitution set at $3,248.31 payable to Arial S., and $974.79 payable to Glendale Kohl's Department Store; to be paid first; due by the end of probation
-All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments, and restitution to be paid, including DNA surcharge, during the period of probation. If revoked, to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instructions, filed.

Defendant Nathaniel Howard Guard in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Nathaniel Howard Guard.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 and 3: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.

AS TO COUNT 2 and 4: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Court advised defendant if they are not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, they could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 

Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nathaniel Howard Guard in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Nathaniel Howard Guard in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a plea and sentencing.  Defense requests an adjournment to allow for further negotiations with the State.  Court rescheduled the matter as requested.  Defendant has a pending matter in front of Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Court will accept transfer of case for possible global resolution.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Nathaniel Howard Guard not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case is calendared for a plea and sentencing hearing. Parties are pursuing drug treatment court. Case is adjourned.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Nathaniel Howard Guard not in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Court will accept case from branch 2 for global resolution.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Nathaniel Howard Guard not in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and global offer and request case set for additional hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Nathaniel Howard Guard not in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Scheduling Conference.  Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned , Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Nathaniel Howard Guard in court by video with Attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Nathaniel Howard Guard in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Brett Copeland by video on behalf of Attorney  Katherine Graber in court, defendant Nathaniel Howard Guard not in court, in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Graber is unavailable. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Rehmat Food Mart; Metro by T-Mobile
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Nathaniel Howard Guard in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Nathaniel Howard Guard in custody.  Allysa Bria Brown appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nathaniel Howard Guard appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
